name: plastic flake production, consumer electronics, for recycling, by grinding/shredding, formal sector | plastic flake, consumer electronics, for recycling | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19853/documentation

The formal plastic recycling sector in India contributes to a comparitively smaller percentage of the overall plastic recycling of the country in comparison with the informal sector. Once the received plastics are segregated, cleaned and sorted, the plastics are ground into smaller flakes. The grinding phase generally comprises of shredders that reduce bulk plastics into smaller flakes. Visited formal recyclers were from different parts of the country based out of Pune, Bangalore, Hyderabad. Electricity is obtained from the grid. Data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers and on-site visits were carried out. Information provided was verified and actual readings were taken related to electrical energy consumption the formal sector. The dataset is representation of production of plastic wastes from grinding operations.

This dataset include activities that occur once the material is sorted and is received for grinding or shredding.

This dataset includes activities until the received sorted waste plastics is ground or shredded into smaller plastic flakes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The recycling sector has been following this method for several years. There is no anticipated change in the next few years in their method of working. However, with the new e-waste rules in the country, bringing in more focus on sustainable recycling, certain changes are expected to occur over a period of time.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The geography included for the formal sector includes the leading formal plastic recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The technology that is used in the formal sector is standard and is uniformly adopted by all the formal recyclers. The equipment is maintained and is not of very old technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The geography included for the formal sector is a wide representation of formal recyclers spread across the country.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: An initial data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers. On-site visits were carried out and data was collected from leading recyclers in the formal recycling sector. Information provided was verified and readings were taken for information that is unavailable with the formal sector. The recyclers were engaged into recycling of plastics mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc.Data collected from different recyclers was compiled in the excel sheets and analysed. All the data was aggregated to per 1000 kgs of production of plastic flakes.

exchanges.description: plastic flakes produced from the grinding operations.

flow.name: plastic flake, consumer electronics, for recycling

exchanges.description: It is proxy for Ethylene Propylene Diene (EPDM) Chemical. EPDM is is a copolymer of ethylene, propylene and a small amount of non-conjugated diene monomers (3 - 9 percent) which provide cross-linking sites for vulcanization and is used by formal recyclers. http://polymerdatabase.com/Elastomers/EPDM.html

exchanges.description: This exchange represents the cleaned and sorted material used by formal and informal plastic recycling sectors in India. These recyclers are engaged into recycling of different plastic types from e-waste/WEEE, mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Poly Propylene (PP) etc
